authors: Nic White For Daily Mail Australia
description: A 61-year-old woman was so angry a fast food drive-through in in Hervey Bay, central Queensland wouldn't serve her on a mobility scooter the police had to be called after she 'became aggressive'.
title: Hervey Bay scooter driver became aggressive in drive-thru
title_page: Hervey Bay scooter driver became aggressive in drive-thru | Daily Mail Online
text:
A 61-year-old woman was so angry a fast food drive-through wouldn't serve her on a mobility scooter the police had to be called.
The woman became aggressive when she was denied service at the 24-hour outlet in Hervey Bay, central Queensland, about 1am on Wednesday.
Staff told her their customer service policy did not allow them to serve her while she was driving the scooter.
A 61-year-old woman was so angry a fast food drive-through wouldn't serve her on a mobility scooter the police had to be called (stock image)
She became irate upon hearing this and became so aggressive that staff called police.
Police issued the woman with a public nuisance infringement notice for her behaviour.
